Author: buzzer9229
Content:
@Cabinet Member @Parliament Member @Judiciary Member @Apparatus 

This is the current situation of Indonesia:

1. **Issue**
-**Indonesia is facing a job crisis**. About 800,000 Indonesians remain unemployed due to bad education, work quality, poor labor laws, and bad business policies that prevent the private sector to grow and hire workers. For the past three months, there has been demonstrations in the street demanding the government to step in and fix the job crisis. There is also AI stepping into industries and completely eliminating the need for the human element which contributes to the issue.
-**The Indonesian government is facing a public communication issue**. The general public trusts the opinions and the news coming from influencers and content creators than the government which fuels resentment against the government. The government must work to fix communication and build trust towards the general public.
-**Indonesia is suffering from economic inequality**. The Indonesian economy is growing, but bad trickle down policies and incompetent welfare guarantees create a massive wealth gap between the rich and the poor inside the Indonesian government. A month ago, a large demonstration of students and laborers were met with repressive action from the authorities. If this is not dealt with soon it could lead to more riots and a possible revolution. The people are demanding reformation, evaluation and rooting out of corruption. There's also a decreasing in investment.
-**There's a growing radical movement**. Due to economic hardships, there are growing amounts of people who embrace far left ideas and far right ideas for politics and economy. The government must work to either pacify the populace through policy and governance or crush this dissent.
-**The US and China tensions over Asia-Pacific is rising**. Indonesia is stuck between having to side with the US or China with two countries holding leverage over Indonesia.

Author: buzzer9229
Content:
2. **Crisis**
-**7,000 are poisoned due to bad Free Lunch Meals roll out**. At the start of his presidency, President @Kim desired to roll out the Free Lunch program and promised thousands of families that they won't have to burden themselves with buying lunch anymore. The program is given over control to Minister of Economy @truffle | gekoloniseerd who is responsible for setting the core of the policy through heavy government intervention and Minister of Domestic Affairs @Tota Genkai who is responsible for the deployment of food at schools. The government must either address this problem, stop the roll outs, re-evaluate or completely cut funding which will harm President Kim's credibility.
-**A separatist force over at Kalimantan fights a war against the Indonesian government**. The Indonesian government has been fighting against the Borneo Liberation Front since 2024. They demand West Kalimantan to secede from the Republic of Indonesia. Fighting has been going for two years with 800 Indonesian soldiers dead, and 2,000 injured. Minister of Defense @Yoska ( Your Mughal Vizier ) has been a strong proponent against this separatist movement and voices his displeasure in public, while Chief of Military @Yuru-san has been accused of incompetence and corruption despite only receiving marching orders and equipment from the Minister of Defense. Minister of Finance @Universe Janitor also has been accused of prolonging the war by continuing to budget the military operation. A resolution either peaceful or forceful is needed to break this crisis.

Content:

3. **Ministers and parliament members can lobby the President or Minister of Finance for bigger budgets**

**FAILURE TO ALLOCATE BUDGET IN THREE REALTIME DAYS WILL RESULT IN A GOVERNMENT SHUTDOWN**

Author: buzzer9229
Content:
@Cabinet Member @Parliament Member @Judiciary Member @Apparatus 

***NEWS***

**Government in a loop? President and Minister of Finance has yet to announce budget allocations**

With no news of government budget allocation from the President and Minister of Finance, as well as word from the Parliament that will approve it, government programs are beginning to deteriorate. It has been reported that 300 BJPS patients across Java and 500 BPJS patients across Sumatera has yet to receive medical care from the Ministry of Domestic Affairs, while Free Meals Lunch Program continues to roll out food that are deteriorating in quality, fueling more cases of poisoning and public uproar. How long will the government take to allocate the State Budget?

Author: buzzer9229
Content:
@Cabinet Member @Parliament Member @Judiciary Member @Apparatus 

***NEWS***

**Separatists have begun assault on Pontianak.**

The Borneo Liberation Front has begun taking over hamlets and roads heading towards Pontianak from the Southeast, with 19 soldiers dead from the attack and about 40 citizens have been killed in the firefight. The perimeter towards Pontianak has been breached due to the lack of personnel and equipment deployed to protect the city. Many military observers have noted that this is the result of late budget allocation into defense and the military contributing to a separatist breakthrough. Many blame President @Kim and Minister of Defense @Yoska ( Your Mughal Vizier ) of not taking the situation seriously, instead focusing on political consolidation as rumors of a merger between the NAPFAR and FFA circulate in Jakarta. As the conflict escalates, threatening the local population and economy, citizens in Kalimantan has begin asking if the government can really protect them?

Author: buzzer9229
Content:
@Cabinet Member @Parliament Member @Judiciary Member @Apparatus 

***NEWS***

**Talks Between Government and Borneo Rebels Stagnate**

After days of heavy clashes on the outskirts of Pontianak, the Ministry of Defense initiated an emergency meeting between the Armed Forces, local Sultans, and Chiefdom leaders to seek a path to peace with the Borneo Liberation Front (BLF). Minister of Defense @Yoska ( Your Mughal Vizier ) , a native of West Borneo, personally traveled to the province to oversee the talks and persuade the rebels to halt their advance.

While the discussions managed to create limited humanitarian corridors in several hamlets, no substantial agreement was reached. The BLF continues to hold control over key routes leading to Pontianak, launching sporadic attacks despite the negotiations. Local observers describe the outcome as a ‚Äústalemate,‚Äù offering only a temporary reprieve of one or two weeks before the threat of a larger offensive resumes.

The lack of progress has intensified criticism toward President @Kim  and Minister of Defense @Yoska ( Your Mughal Vizier ) , with accusations that the government is showing weakness at a critical moment. Many military analysts argue that the negotiations were undermined by years of delayed defense budgets and under-equipped forces in Kalimantan. Citizens in West Borneo, caught between the BLF‚Äôs advances and the government‚Äôs uncertain response, are now questioning if the state has the capacity‚Äîor the will‚Äîto secure Pontianak before it falls.

Author: buzzer9229
Content:
@Cabinet Member @Parliament Member @Judiciary Member @Apparatus 

***NEWS***

**Labrador Leak: Intelligence Budget Accidentally Revealed in WhatsApp Blunder**

The nation‚Äôs intelligence community is facing an unusual storm after Chief of Security Labrador accidentally revealed a Rp 210 billion operations budget in the wrong WhatsApp groupchat. What was meant to be a classified breakdown of spending for secret informants, facilities, and day-to-day operations was instead delivered to a community chat containing journalists and local officials.

Within hours, screenshots spread across social media, sparking a meme frenzy under hashtags like #LabradorLeaks and #SpyDogBudget. Images of cartoon Labradors in sunglasses holding briefcases of cash flooded TikTok, turning what could have been a serious security breach into a national punchline.

Lawmakers, however, were less amused. Opposition figures questioned how an agency trusted with national secrets could mishandle basic messaging apps. ‚ÄúIf they can‚Äôt manage WhatsApp, how can they manage espionage?‚Äù one parliamentarian asked during a heated session. Calls for oversight hearings grew louder as critics demanded accountability for both the blunder and the massive sums allocated.

Inside the agency, panic set in. Sources confirmed an emergency directive banning WhatsApp for official communication, with all staff ordered onto a government-issued secure messaging platform. A crash training in digital hygiene is also being rolled out, after senior officials privately admitted that operational credibility had been ‚Äúseriously dented.‚Äù

As the memes keep rolling and the parliament prepares for inquiry, one question lingers: has the leak done more damage to the nation‚Äôs security, or to its sense of dignity?

Author: buzzer9229
Content:
@Cabinet Member @Parliament Member @Judiciary Member @Apparatus 

***NEWS***

***MASS LABOR STRIKES IN CENTRAL JAVA***

Thousands of laborers across Central Java have launched coordinated strikes after the Ministry of Domestic Affairs @StaroW  failed to allocate any budget toward welfare programs. The workers, organized under several large unions, are demanding that the President @Kim personally intervene to protect the wong cilik ‚Äî ordinary working people ‚Äî by ensuring access to BPJS health coverage, family subsidies, and affordable housing projects.

The strikes have brought production lines to a standstill in key sectors. Garment and textile factories in Semarang and Solo have halted exports, Jepara‚Äôs furniture workshops are struggling to meet international contracts, and bottlenecks are emerging in food processing and agricultural distribution. Tanjung Emas Port, a vital export hub, is now reporting shipment delays as logistics workers join the action.

The political fallout is intensifying. Business owners, alarmed by mounting losses and the threat to Indonesia‚Äôs credibility as a manufacturing base, are pressuring the Minister of Economy @truffle | gekoloniseerd for immediate resolution. At the same time, the Chief of Police @gingermusk faces calls from both employers and regional leaders to restore order and prevent further disruption.

Observers warn that the government‚Äôs handling of the crisis will be critical. If Jakarta fails to balance economic stability with the demands of the wong cilik, the strikes could escalate beyond Central Java, threatening investor confidence and igniting broader social unrest across the archipelago.

Author: buzzer9229
Content:
@Cabinet Member @Parliament Member @Judiciary Member @Apparatus 

***NEWS***

**CHINA OFFERS BILLIONS FOR PHASE 2 OF JAKARTA‚ÄìBANDUNG HIGH-SPEED RAIL EXTENDING TO SURABAYA**

The People‚Äôs Republic of China has formally approached the Indonesian government with an offer of USD 3.2 billion in fresh investment to continue Phase 2 of the Jakarta‚ÄìBandung High-Speed Bullet Train project, extending the line towards Surabaya. The move signals Beijing‚Äôs determination to deepen its role in Indonesia‚Äôs infrastructure development, but also raises sensitive questions about Jakarta‚Äôs foreign policy alignment.

While the investment promises thousands of new jobs and a major boost to transport connectivity, analysts warn that accepting the deal could be read as Indonesia drifting further from Washington‚Äôs orbit. U.S. officials have previously expressed concern that China‚Äôs Belt and Road investments consolidate strategic leverage across Southeast Asia.

The decision now sits at the heart of a political and diplomatic dilemma. The Minister of Foreign Affairs @Tota Genkai  is tasked with managing the potential fallout with Western partners, particularly the United States. The Minister of Economy @truffle | gekoloniseerd  is under pressure from business groups to seize the opportunity, citing growth and investor confidence. Meanwhile, the Minister of Finance @Universe Janitor faces scrutiny over the long-term debt implications, as Phase 1 of the high-speed rail already drew criticism for cost overruns and financial opacity.

Political observers note that President @Kim 's cabinet is split. Proponents argue that refusing China‚Äôs offer would stall a flagship national project, while opponents fear the geopolitical price of appearing overly dependent on Beijing. As negotiations proceed, the government must weigh economic ambition against the delicate balance of Indonesia‚Äôs non-aligned foreign policy tradition.

Author: buzzer9229
Content:
@Cabinet Member @Parliament Member @Judiciary Member @Apparatus 

***NEWS***

**Anonymous Accounts Spread False Allegations Amid Central Java Crisis**

A wave of anonymous social media accounts and unverified blogs sparked controversy yesterday after circulating claims that the President and the Minister of Finance held a secret coalition meeting during the ongoing crisis in Central Java.

The posts, which appeared simultaneously on multiple platforms, accused both leaders of ‚Äúneglecting the people‚Äù and ‚Äúpursuing political power instead of solutions.‚Äù However, checks conducted by a Verification Team found no evidence of such a meeting taking place, nor of any cabinet reorganization related to the claims.

‚ÄúWe see clear signs of coordinated disinformation‚Äîidentical wording, synchronized timing, and use of clickbait-style hashtags,‚Äù said the Digital Integrity Institute.

Government Spokesperson condemned the attempt, calling it ‚Äúirresponsible and exploitative.‚Äù

‚ÄúThe administration‚Äôs focus remains on crisis relief, not political maneuvering,‚Äù she said during a brief press conference. ‚ÄúEfforts to manipulate the public at a time like this endanger unity and trust.‚Äù

Meanwhile, several digital rights groups expressed concern that the spread of fabricated information could worsen polarization online. 

Analytics firm TaktikData reported that most of the viral posts originated from accounts with low engagement histories, many created within the past two weeks. Some of those accounts have since been suspended.

Despite the government‚Äôs swift rebuttal, the episode has reignited debate over the role of paid influencers and anonymous ‚Äúbuzzers‚Äù in shaping political narratives ‚Äî a recurring theme in Indonesia‚Äôs evolving information landscape.

Public reaction, meanwhile, has largely condemned the smear, with many online users rallying under the hashtag #CrisisNotPolitics, urging focus on humanitarian response rather than partisan games.

Author: buzzer9229
Content:
@Cabinet Member @Parliament Member @Judiciary Member @Apparatus 

***BREAKING NEWS***

**INDONESIA REJECTS MYANMAR EXTRADITION REQUEST, OFFERS HUMAN RIGHTS TRIBUNAL INSTEAD**

In a move that has sent ripples through both ASEAN and international diplomatic circles, the Minister of Justice, Nero, has formally rejected Myanmar‚Äôs request to extradite a political dissident currently detained in Indonesia. Instead, Nero has proposed to host an independent tribunal on Indonesian soil, citing serious concerns over the dissident‚Äôs right to due process and fears of possible torture or execution if returned to Myanmar.

‚ÄúIndonesia cannot, in good conscience, be complicit in the potential violation of human rights,‚Äù said Minister Nero in a late-night press briefing. ‚ÄúWe are a sovereign nation with our own commitment to justice.‚Äù

The decision comes amidst mounting pressure from human rights organizations, international legal watchdogs, and urban civil society groups, many of whom had taken to social media and street demonstrations urging the Indonesian government not to hand over the dissident. The move has earned Nero significant praise both domestically and abroad, with several international NGOs hailing Indonesia‚Äôs commitment to human rights as ‚Äúa landmark decision for Southeast Asian democracy.‚Äù

However, the decision has not come without cost. Several Myanmar-aligned firms and Chinese business entities have begun pulling investments and delaying infrastructure projects in Kalimantan and Sumatra, triggering what experts call a ‚Äúcontained but visible economic chill.‚Äù

The Ministry of Finance has already downgraded short-term growth projections by ‚àí1 point in response, though officials maintain the fundamentals of the Indonesian economy remain stable.

‚ÄúWe are watching the market closely,‚Äù said Minister Universe Janitor. ‚ÄúThe decision to uphold human rights is not incompatible with our long-term growth model.‚Äù

Author: buzzer9229
Content:
@Cabinet Member @Parliament Member @Judiciary Member @Apparatus 
***NEWS***

Hundreds of protestors have gathered this morning in front of the People‚Äôs Representative Council (PRC), decrying what they call a ‚Äúdereliction of duty‚Äù by Parliament over the tardy ratification of the National Budget. The protest is one of the largest in recent years and includes students, workers, BPJS health advocates, teachers‚Äô unions, indigenous groups, and victims‚Äô families from the Borneo Liberation conflict zones.

‚ÄúOur medicine has run out. Our children are hungry. Our hospitals have no supplies,‚Äù said a protestor from Kalimantan Timur
‚ÄòWe Die While They Debate‚Äô.
‚ÄúWhy is Parliament fighting over seats while our villages burn?‚Äù

This delay affects:
1. BPJS Health Services in remote provinces report rationing medicine and delaying elective procedures.
2. The Free Meals Program for Public Schools, a flagship welfare policy, has halted in 42 districts due to lack of funding.
3. Strategic infrastructure projects across Kalimantan and Papua‚Äîincluding bridges, roads, and telecommunication hubs‚Äîhave stopped construction mid-phase.
4. Military and logistical support to the Borneo Liberation Front conflict zones have been stretched thin, with some units reporting late or absent resupply for over two weeks.

‚ÄúThe delay in Parliament has directly cost us lives,‚Äù said a source within the Joint Defense Command, referencing the 2,000 casualties reported so far in the Borneo insurgency. The Speaker of the Parliament, @G CAT  (DemPro), is reportedly refusing to fast-track the budget until President @Kim increases parliamentary budget.

Several protesters have begun calling for the resignation of key political figures, including:
1. Speaker @G CAT 
2. Minister of Finance @Universe Janitor 
3. Minister of Domestic Affairs @StaroW 
4. Any party head involved in ‚Äústalling the budget for political gain‚Äù

Author: buzzer9229
Content: Parliament has less than 72 hours to push a temporary budget through or risk a constitutional emergency.

Author: buzzer9229
Content:
@Cabinet Member @Parliament Member @Judiciary Member @Apparatus 

***NEWS***

**YOSKA DECLARES DAERAH OPERASI MILITER WEST KALIMANTAN, MAJOR OPERATION FAILS SPECTACULARLY**

In a historic and controversial move, Minister of Defense @Yoska ( Your Mughal Vizier ) , with direct approval from President @Kim , has officially declared the entire province of West Kalimantan a Daerah Operasi Militer.

The decision comes amid a worsening crisis involving the Borneo Liberation Front (BLF), whose insurgency has claimed over 2,000 lives in the past 18 months. The DOM declaration grants sweeping authority to the Indonesian National Armed Forces (TNI) to conduct operations across civilian territories, impose curfews, establish checkpoints, and eliminate high-value targets with minimal civilian oversight.

The declaration of DOM follows the launch of Operation Kabut, a TNI-led military operation aimed at neutralizing BLF leadership through a joint effort of special forces and drone support. The operation deployed 3 squads of Kopassus, several transport helicopter and drones.

The mission objective was the targetting of BLF high command believed to be operating deep within the jungles of West Kalimantan. However, the operation ended in failure. According to high-level sources within the Ministry of Defence: The BLF leadership escaped the raid, potentially wounded.

Author: buzzer9229
Content:
The TNI suffered multiple casualties, with several operatives injured during an unexpected ambush. 7 civilians ‚Äî including a teacher and two children ‚Äî were killed in a drone strike after being misidentified as BLF. Footage of the aftermath, including bloodied school supplies and civilian funerals, began circulating online.

The hashtags #KabutMassacre, #DOMBukanSolusi, and #YoskaResign are trending across Indonesian social media platforms. Netizens and civil society groups accuse the government of reckless militarization. 

In the wake of civilian deaths, several prominent human rights watchdogs, including the Jakarta Institute for Civil Freedoms and ASEAN Justice Network, have issued open letters urging Attorney General @rxse (rose!) and Minister of Justice @ebonydarknessdementiaravenway investigate the Minister of Defense @Yoska ( Your Mughal Vizier ) and Chief of the Armed Forces @Yuru-san

Author: buzzer9229
Content:
@Cabinet Member @Parliament Member @Judiciary Member @Apparatus 

***NEWS***

**CABINET SECRETARY SHIAWASE BLUNDERS AFTER PUBLIC EXPOSE**

Cabinet Secretary @shiawase  (FFA) found himself in the eye of a political storm after making a surprise public announcement accusing three ministries of "complete inaction" following Parliament‚Äôs approval of the national budget.

The ministries named ‚Äî Justice ( @ebonydarknessdementiaravenway , PJF), Finance ( @Universe Janitor , NUP), and Energy and Resources ( @retropolism , PJF) ‚Äî were blasted by Shiawase for ‚Äúnot even preparing their draft programs‚Äù three days after the budget's passing.

But what was intended as a call to accountability has instead sparked cabinet infighting, social media backlash, and an emerging narrative that Shiawase‚Äôs actions were politically motivated and potentially destabilizing during an ongoing national crisis.

#MenteriNgadu and #SeskabNgamuk trend online as many believe Shiawase's expose is politically charged. Opinion split: some applaud the boldness, others call it ‚Äúattention-seeking theatrics‚Äù.

Satirical memes of Shiawase wearing a ‚ÄúMinister Monitor‚Äù badge go viral.

An episode of "Indonesia's Judging Club" discussed this issue and some of the speakers in the episode accused Shiawase of softly sabotaging the workings of the cabinet.

Author: buzzer9229
Content:
@Cabinet Member @Parliament Member @Judiciary Member @Apparatus 

***NEWS***

**PARLIAMENT IS ON LIMBO FOR ALMOST A MONTH**

After the ratification of the 2026 Budget, the Parliament has seen no further discussion in pushing any bills, as the public faces a job crisis and constituents demand for their representatives to push Bills. Speaker of the Parliament @G CAT has not surfaced in the public view since a few weeks after the ratification of the 2026 Budget, while Deputy Speaker @Deleted User has been seen attending party rallies and meetings rather than fulfilling her duty in the parliament.

Social media is beginning to be abuzz, questioning whether or not the Parliament is able do deliver bills for its people, with many people calling President @Kim and the other party bosses to begin mobilizing bills. The public worry that their representatives are not doing the jobs they're supposed to be doing. Sources say that if the Parliament does not begin working on any bills, the public might react negatively.

Author: buzzer9229
Content:
@Cabinet Member @Parliament Member @Judiciary Member @Apparatus 

***NEWS***

**POLICE OPERATION FAILS TO IDENTIFY CYBER MASTERMIND IN CENTRAL JAVA**

Amid the spiraling Central Java labor crisis, a cyber-intelligence operation launched by the Chief of Police @gingermusk to identify the mastermind behind a rapidly spreading disinformation campaign has failed to produce results, sparking fresh concerns about state surveillance, digital incompetence, and political cover-ups.

The operation, initiated to trace the origins of anonymous accounts flooding social media with coordinated accusations against President @Kim  and Minister of Finance @Universe Janitor, ended in disarray after investigators reported that the campaign was routed through a complex mesh of proxy servers, false IPs, and burner accounts. Instead of unmasking the actors, investigators reportedly struck dead ends and, worse, flagged unrelated civilian accounts, raising questions of privacy violation.

Though official verification teams quickly labeled the online accusations as ‚Äúunsubstantiated and algorithmically amplified,‚Äù the public has been largely unconvinced. Hashtags like #DigitalFail, #CyberBlunder, and #WhoPolicesThePolice trended across platforms, while civil society groups accused the police of "wasting taxpayer money chasing shadows."

The disinformation campaign itself remains active. Anonymous accounts continue to circulate messages accusing the administration of colluding with corporate elites to suppress labor demands. Though experts say the accounts display ‚Äúclear hallmarks of artificial coordination‚Äù ‚Äî such as identical phrasing, synchronized posting, and recent creation ‚Äî the mastermind remains unknown.

The timing of the campaign, coinciding with budget delays and ongoing labor unrest in Semarang, Salatiga, and Surakarta, has led to growing speculation of internal sabotage or even foreign interference.

Author: buzzer9229
Content:
@Cabinet Member @Parliament Member @Judiciary Member @Apparatus 

***BREAKING NEWS***

**ATTEMPTED ARSON ALMOST BURNT MINISTER STAROW'S HOUSE**

At night in 2am, a man was apprehended by members of the Indonesian police force attempting to start a fire on Minister @StaroW 's residence. The man, identified as West Javan native Amir Sundaman, was resentful over the recent Free Meals Program that put his son into a state of coma after his son was poisoned by the free meal. While Minister StaroW and his family was unharmed, the fire managed to burn the security post of his residence.

The police suspected that this attack was politically motivated, as the attacker Amir Sundaman seems to be a part of a right wing focus group, however reports are inconclusive at best and many of the public criticized the government for accusing Amir's violent act as politically motivated when many believed he was acting out of passion.

This attack came as the Ministry of Domestic Affairs were slow to act regarding the Free Lunch Program and overhauling its roll outs. What will the cabinet do as some in Indonesia are contemplating violence against its leaders?

Author: buzzer9229
Content:
@Cabinet Member @Parliament Member @Judiciary Member @Apparatus 

***NEWS***

**MBS: OIL PRICES WILL HIKE**

Yesterday morning, the Iranian government has announced renewed retaliation against Israeli territories and the IDF, worrying many supply chains and petroleum operations over at the Middle East. 12 hours later, Prince Muhammad Bin Salman, in a historic press conference, states that Iran's retaliation would probably shake up the prices of the global oil market as Iranian Navy begins to amass over at the Strait of Hormuz and the Indian Ocean. Secretary of State Marco Rubio responded with a press conference that the United States will send its fleet to the Middle East in an effort to maintain security, while observers note that this is a calculated attempt by the United States to stabilize global prices.

In Indonesia, spotlight moves towards Minister of Energy and Resource @retropolism, as many companies and the public worrying that the conflict in the Middle East will affect the economy in a negative way. Experts warn Indonesia should begin coming up with a solution to offset the possibility of prices hiking.

Author: buzzer9229
Content:
@Cabinet Member @Parliament Member @Judiciary Member @Apparatus 

***NEWS***

**SON OF AN NUP BOSS CAUGHT IN A SCANDAL**

Last night, a man (21 years old) has been caught by the Indonesian police of hosting an inappropriate party over at a luxury hotel in downtown Jakarta. Hotel goers complained about disturbing noises coming from one of the luxury suites, and when one of the hotel goers, an Malaysian and Indonesian businessman confronted the man alongside a hotel manager, a fight broke out. The hotel called the Indonesian police to disperse the fight. As the Indonesian police inspected the scene, they found undeniable evidence of an inappropriate group party of 6 men and 11 women all under the age of 26 being held.

The prime suspect was revealed to be a son of an NUP Party boss, whom the police has identified to be "BR". The footage of the fight went viral over at Social Media with many identifying the suspect to be indeed be BR, son of an NUP boss. The NUP boss is linked to President @Kim , Minister of Economy @truffle | gekoloniseerd and Minister of Foreign Affairs @Manes . 

Public is demanding that a proper trial is held and that no political elements interfere, while many in the NUP are apparently shaken by this event. How will the NUP proceed facing this major scandal?

The government is undergoing training of various kitchens, staff, cooks and experts to improve the quality of the meals allocating 340B IDR in budget. While the general populace are finally relieved that the government is beginning to take the Free Meal Program seriously, many are still skeptic to see the results of the policy improvements as Minister of Domestic Affairs @StaroW pledge to provide children across Indonesia the nutrition they require to fight stunting and malnutrition.

Things are looking up for the government, but this is the first step towards the Indonesian government finally winning back public trust.

Author: buzzer9229
Content:
@Cabinet Member @Parliament Member @Judiciary Member @Apparatus 

***NEWS***

**Government Launches Rp 500 Billion Infrastructure Boost to Develop Outer Islands**

The Indonesian government, under Minister of Economy @truffle | gekoloniseerd  has unveiled a bold Rp 500 trillion infrastructure policy package aimed at accelerating development outside Java, especially in Kalimantan and Papua. This initiative is expected to enhance connectivity, public services, and digital access in neglected regions.

Breakdown of the allocation includes:

Rp 200B for the construction and maintenance of rural roads, bridges, irrigation, sanitation systems, and flood control, with a strong focus on local SMEs for project execution.

Rp 100B dedicated to renovating schools, clinics, and hospitals, improving visibility and access to vital public services.

Rp 100B invested into communication infrastructure, expanding 5G coverage, building more BTS towers, and upgrading satellite internet through collaboration with Telkom and Starlink.

Rp 75B to fund vocational training programs and job distribution, especially in coordination with regional governments.

Rp 25B for monitoring, logistics, procurement, and administrative operations.

Experts view the initiative as a potential game-changer for regional equity. ‚ÄúThis is a chance to bridge the development gap between Java and the rest of Indonesia,‚Äù said one economist. However, concerns remain about corruption, project delays, and the capacity of ministries to execute such a large-scale plan effectively. Transparency and coordination, they warn, will be critical. Public reaction is mixed‚Äîmany praise the focus on outer islands, while others worry about corruption and demand transparency in project execution.

Author: buzzer9229
Content:
@Cabinet Member @Parliament Member @Judiciary Member @Apparatus 

***NEWS***

**MILITARY OPERATION AGAINST BORNEAN SEPARATISTS REACHED BREAKTHROUGH**

In a dramatic and closely watched campaign, Indonesian security forces have declared a decisive victory in West Kalimantan after a months‚Äëlong offensive against the Borneo Liberation Front (BLF), the insurgent group that for more than a year had terrorized towns, disrupted services and claimed thousands of lives across the region. Government officials announced early today that the coordinated operation ‚Äî a multi‚Äëservice campaign involving the Indonesian Army‚Äôs strategic reserves, naval and marine units, and air force assets ‚Äî successfully dismantled the BLF‚Äôs operational command and restored formal control over the province‚Äôs major population centers, most notably Pontianak.

President @Kim addressed the nation with a measured tone, emphasizing both relief and resolve. ‚ÄúToday we mark a turning point for West Borneo and for the Republic,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúOur armed forces, working with local authorities and supported by humanitarian agencies, have ended a reign of terror that took too many lives. We will now move from combat operations to a rapid and transparent program of stabilization, reconstruction and justice.‚Äù

Government sources say the campaign was launched after domestic efforts to contain the insurgency failed to halt its expansion into urban peripheries. The declaration of a Daerah Operasi Militer (DOM) placed the theater under centralized military command and allowed Jakarta to mobilize additional resources and capabilities. According to the Defense Ministry, the offensive prioritized the protection of civilians and the reclamation of key infrastructure: roads, bridges, water works and health facilities that insurgent attacks had repeatedly targeted.

Author: buzzer9229
Content: A statement from the Minister of Defense @Yoska ( Your Mughal Vizier )  described the operation as ‚Äúsurgically coordinated and intelligence‚Äëdriven,‚Äù focusing on isolating insurgent strongholds and severing their logistical lines. While military spokespeople declined to divulge operational specifics, they confirmed that ‚Äúleadership cadres‚Äù were captured or neutralized and that BLF‚Äôs organized capacity to stage mass attacks has been disrupted to the point that the movement no longer constitutes a sustained, coordinated military threat on the ground.

Author: buzzer9229
Content: Local officials in Pontianak told reporters that the return of security has been tangible. Schools that had shuttered amid repeated threats reopened in recent days. Markets and small businesses that had seen customers vanish are beginning to operate again, and emergency medical teams report that hospital deliveries of essential medicines have resumed. ‚ÄúThe relief is real,‚Äù said Mayor Lestari Putri. ‚ÄúBut we are only at the start of rebuilding trust.‚Äù

Author: buzzer9229
Content: For many Indonesians, the campaign‚Äôs declared end of organized BLF operations offers relief but not yet resolution. The technical defeat of an insurgent command is a necessary milestone; durable peace will depend on addressing the political and economic conditions that allowed the BLF to gain recruits and legitimacy among some communities.

Author: buzzer9229
Content: In the days ahead, the nation will watch whether Jakarta can convert military gains into tangible, fair and transparent rebuilding ‚Äî and whether the legal and political institutions will hold to the promise of accountability. For the families who have lost loved ones and for the communities uprooted by violence, the truest test will be whether peace brings them back to their homes and livelihoods, and whether the state keeps its pledge to protect and to rebuild.
